name: Magnificent, Mighty "M" Quiz / Test | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Before Mark Wahlberg became known as "Mark Wahlberg" he had a group; what was it called?
questions.correct: Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch
options: Marc Mark and the Funky Bunch
Mister Mark and the Funky Bunch
Marvellous Mark and the Funky Bunch
questions.explanation:
Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch.

	Mark Robert Michael Wahlberg was born on June 5, 1971 in Boston, Massachusetts.  He is the younger brother of former New Kids on the Block member Donnie Wahlberg.

questions.text: Which "M" state in the US comes first alphabetically?
questions.explanation:
Maine.

	The "M" states in alphabetical order are: Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, and Montana.  The capital of Maine is Augusta. It was entered the union on March 15, 1820. It is the 23rd state.  This information came from www.50states.com.

questions.text: Who is the Roman god of war?
questions.explanation:
Mars.

	Mars was the god of war and agriculture. Mercury was the god of trade and profit.

questions.text: What does the 2 Ms stand for in M&Ms chocolate?
questions.explanation:
Mars & Murrie.

	Mars invented M&Ms during the Spanish Civil War. They were first sold to the public in 1941.

questions.text: Starting with George Washington and going in order who was the third president whose surname begins with an "M"?
questions.explanation:
McKinley.

	McKinley was the 25th president of the United States. He was in office from 1897-1901. He was assassinated by Leon Czolgosz. Theodore Roosevelt, McKinley's VP then became president in 1901.

questions.text: Which of the following words is a reflexive pronoun?
questions.explanation:
myself.

	A reflexive pronoun is a pronoun that refers back to the person. Myself refers back to me. Usually in English reflexive pronouns have the word "self" in them. Eg: Myself, yourself, herself, themselves.

questions.text: What is the Spanish word for table?
questions.explanation:
mesa.

	La mesa is table, menos is less, muy is very and el mono means monkey.

questions.text: Who wrote "I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings"?
questions.explanation:
Maya Angelou.

	Mary Higgins Clark wrote "Daddy's Little Girl". Mercedes Lackey wrote "By the Sword." Mary Renault wrote "The Persian Boy".

questions.text: What is Sam Malone's nickname on "Cheers"?
questions.explanation:
Mayday.

	Sam Malone was a relief pitcher for the Red Sox, he left the sport due to a drinking problem he had. He then bought and opened "Cheers" while he was still drinking, and he held onto it for sentimental reasons.

questions.text: Which of these is a place in Tolkien's Middle Earth?
questions.explanation:
Mordor.

	Maryland is a state in the US. Maui is in Hawaii, which is also in the US. Metropolis is the city where Clark Kent and Lois Lane work for the "Daily Planet" in "Superman".
